sen.j: 石川 時光（いしかわ ときみつ、生年不詳 - 建武 (日本)2年4月1日 (旧暦)（1335年4月24日））は、鎌倉時代後期の武将。
sen.e: Tokimitsu ISHIKAWA (year of birth unknown - April 24, 1335) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the late Kamakura period.
Tokimitsu ISHIKAWA (year of birth unknown - April 24, 1335) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the late Kamakura period.
Tokimitsu ISHIKAWA (year of birth unknown - April 24, 1335) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the late Kamakura period.

sen.j: 大和源氏の流れを汲む陸奥石川氏13代目当主。
sen.e: The thirteenth family head of the Mutsu Ishikawa clan which follows Yamato-Genji (Minamoto clan).
He was the 13th family head of the Mutsu Ishikawa clan, which follows Yamato-Genji (Minamoto clan).
sen.cmt: 主語を加えました。10以上なのでアラビア数字表記です。Whichの前に「、」を加えました。
sen.e: He was the 13th family head of the Mutsu Ishikawa clan, which follows Yamato-Genji (Minamoto clan).
He was the fourth son of Moriyoshi ISHIKAWA.
He was the fourth son of Moriyoshi ISHIKAWA.
He was the fourth son of Moriyoshi ISHIKAWA.

sen.j: 従五位下宮内大輔、従四位下大膳大夫。
sen.e: Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Kudai-taifu (post of Imperial Household Ministry), Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table)

He filled posts of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Kudai-taifu (post of Imperial Household Ministry) and Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table).

He filled posts of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Kudai-taifu (post of Imperial Household Ministry) and Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table).
His wife was a daughter of Tomoyoshi TAIRA.

sen.j: 元徳2年（1330年）4月、兄である12代当主石川家光が没すると、その長男石川貞光が幼少であったため光英を養いつつ家督を継いだ。
sen.e: When his brother the twelfth family head Iemitsu ISHIKAWA died in April, 1330, he supported Michifusa and succeeded the family estate because the first son of Iemitsu was very young.

When his elder brother, the 12th family head Iemitsu ISHIKAWA died in April 1330, he supported Michifusa and succeeded the family estate, as Sadamitsu ISHIKAWA the eldest son of Iemitsu was very young.
sen.cmt: 石川貞光の名前が抜けています。兄なのでelder brotherとします。10以上なのでアラビア数字表記です。The first son >> the eldest sonBecause >>, as
sen.e: When his elder brother, the 12th family head Iemitsu ISHIKAWA died in April 1330, he supported Michifusa and succeeded the family estate, as Sadamitsu ISHIKAWA the eldest son of Iemitsu was very young.

sen.j: 光教を名乗っていたが、北条時宗から一字を受けて家光と改める。
sen.e: He was named Kokyo, but was renamed to Iemitsu by borrowing one character from Tokimune HOJO.
He was named Mitsunori, but renamed himself to Iemitsu by borrowing one character from Tokimune HOJO.
sen.cmt: 光教はKokyoではなく、Mitsunoriであると考えられます。原文ですが、「家光と改める」とありますが、「時光」の間違いであると思われます。また、改めるとあるので、「renamed himself to」のほうが適切であると思われます。
sen.e: He was named Mitsunori, but renamed himself to Iemitsu by borrowing one character from Tokimune HOJO.

sen.j: 元弘元年（1331年）、後醍醐天皇が隠岐国に遷され、天皇の呼びかけに応えて倒幕の兵が各地で挙がる。
sen.e: Emperor Godaigo was expelled to Oki Province in 1331, armies were raised in various parts of the country in response to the call from the emperor to overthrow the Shogunate.
As Emperor Godaigo was expelled to Oki Province in 1331, armies were raised in various parts of the country in response to the call from the emperor to overthrow the Shogunate.
sen.cmt: ～によって、という意味で、Asを加えました。
sen.e: As Emperor Godaigo was expelled to Oki Province in 1331, armies were raised in various parts of the country in response to the call from the emperor to overthrow the Shogunate.

sen.j: 元弘3年（1333年）5月17日、長男石川義光の軍は新田義貞に武蔵国で合流し、鎌倉幕府討伐に参戦した。
sen.e: The army of the first son Yoshimitsu ISHIKAWA joined Yoshisada NITTA in Musashi Province and participated in the subjugation of the Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: 石川義光はYoshimitsu ISHIKAWAとしました。
sen.e: The army of Yoshimitsu ISHIKAWA, the eldest son of his, joined Yoshisada NITTA in Musashi Province and participated in the subjugation of the Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: 誰の「長男」であるかを細くしました。The first son >> the eldest son
sen.e: The army of Yoshimitsu ISHIKAWA, his eldest son, joined Yoshisada NITTA in Musashi Province and participated in the subjugation of the Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: the eldest son of his→his eldest son

sen.j: 同年7月、時光は兵を率いて上洛し、従五位下宮内大輔に任ぜられる。
sen.e: Tokimitsu went up to Kyoto with his army and was assigned to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Kudai-taifu (post of Imperial Household Ministry) in July in the same year.
Tokimitsu went up to Kyoto with his army and was assigned to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Kudai-taifu (post of Imperial Household Ministry) in July in the same year.
Tokimitsu went up to Kyoto with his army and was assigned to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Kudai-taifu (post of Imperial Household Ministry) in July in the same year.

sen.j: 建武元年（1334年）2月、一族大寺光広、小高光顕とともに上洛。
sen.e: He, Mitsuhiro ODERA and Teruaki ODAKA went up to Kyoto in February, 1334.
sen.cmt: 大寺光広はMitsuhiro ODERA、小高光顕はTeruaki ODAKAとしました。
sen.e: In February 1334, he went up to Kyoto with his family members, Mitsuhiro ODERA and Teruaki ODAKA.
sen.cmt: 一族が訳抜けです。文の構成を変更しました。一族＝大寺光広＆小高光顕ととりましたが、大寺光広のみという場合も考えられます（確認は取れませんでした）。
sen.e: In February 1334, he went up to Kyoto with his family members, Mitsuhiro ODERA and Teruaki ODAKA.

sen.j: 時光は従四位下大膳大夫、光広は左京亮、光顕は主膳正にそれぞれ任じられる。
sen.e: Tokimitsu, Mitsuhiro and Mitsuaki were assigned to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table), sakyo no suke and Shuzen no Kami, respectively.

Tokimitsu was appointed to ushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table), Mitsuhiro was appointed to sakyo no suke (Assistant Master of the Eastern Capital Offices) and Mitsuaki was appointed to Shuzen no Kami (head of Shuzengen (section of food)).
sen.cmt: 役職を各人の名前の後に続けました。主膳正の補足が抜けています。左京亮の補足が抜けています。
sen.e: Tokimitsu was appointed to ushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table), Mitsuhiro was appointed to sakyo no suke (Assistant Master of the Eastern Capital Offices) and Mitsuaki was appointed to Shuzen no Kami (head of Shuzengen (section of food)).

sen.j: 建武2年（1335年）4月1日没し、光英が跡を継いだ。
sen.e: He died on April 1, 1335, and Mitsuhide succeeded him.
He died on April 1, 1335, and Mitsuhide succeeded after him.
He died on April 1, 1335, and Mitsuhide succeeded after him.
